subhead: At least 50 people who crossed the Channel to England have been sent back to France under a new migration deal, with several describing harsh detention conditions and fears of being denied asylum.

title: Catherine Connolly, Irish reunification advocate, elected president
subhead: The left-wing candidate secured 63.4% of the vote, edging her rival Heather Humphreys of Fine Gael, the centrist ruling party. The 68-year-old lawyer managed to unite Ireland's left to win this largely symbolic post.

title: Mohammed Shia al-Sudani, the 'builder' seeking to safeguard Iraq's fragile stability
subhead: As the November 11 legislative election approaches, Iraqi Prime Minister Mohammed Shia al-Sudani, who's running for a second term, has been working to keep his country out of escalating regional tensions.

title: Mouhamadou Fall, first French athlete to join Enhanced Games: 'For me, it's not doping, but a chance to learn more about the human body's limits'
subhead: The French sprinter announced Thursday that he has signed up for the Enhanced Games, an event where doping is permitted – even encouraged. In an interview with Le Monde, the multiple French champion in the 100 m and 200 m explains his decision.

title: First loves: '20 years later, our bodies recognize each other, it's crazy'
subhead: They met, fell in love and then parted ways. Life's twists and turns eventually brought them back together. Marion, 40, shares her story with Ewen, 43, who will give his version of their reunion in the next installment.

title: Brigitte Macron's never-ending fake news nightmare
subhead: For four years, the absurd rumor that the French first lady is a man has continually spread. The Macrons have taken legal action, both in France and in the US.
